website_summaries.verdict: The Xbox One Media Remote is a must-have accessory that makes it much easier to accept a gaming console as the hub of your living room.
pros: The Xbox One Media Remote makes it much more convenient to watch TV and movies on the Xbox One
It feels well-made and includes backlighting that engages as soon as you pick it up
And used with the Kinect, it can control other devices in your living room, like your TV, sound bar, or AV receiver
cons: Requires line-of-sight to the Xbox One console because it uses traditional IR control instead of Bluetooth or Wi-Fi Direct
Doesn't make it any easier to access your DVR from the Xbox One
Some of the buttons' functions aren't immediately apparent

customer_reviews.title: Great range, great feel.
customer_reviews.text: 100% satisfied. The feel of this remote is crazy good. It is a very durable remote and the range to the receiver is great. When you pick the remote up, the buttons light up. When you put it down, the lights immediately go off. I love this because it saves the battery. It's sad to get this excited over a remote, but I wasn't expecting this quality.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lemur

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Blu-ray/Streaming
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought my Xbox One S to watch Blu-rays and stream shows and movies but having to use the controller or the mobile app to play/pause/rewind felt like a hassle. This little remote fixed most of those problems and I am now very happy. The remote works perfectly with Blu-Ray, FandangoNow, Netflix, Youtube & Amazon but not all the buttons work with Hulu & Vudu. The remote itself has a great matte texture, the perfect weight, nice button actuation and fits great in the hand. The only minor complaint that I have is that the Xbox button looks kinda cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: Must-buy for those using TV with Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this if you run your TV through your Xbox One (and you should be doing that). It instantly connects to the nearest Xbox One, so you don't have to pair it or anything. Allows you to navigate the entire Xbox dashboard, as well as your TV listings, and even controls things on your TV like volume and turning it on or off (via Xbox). No need to waste controller battery if you're not actually playing a game.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Makes using the x box much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Better quality than I expected. Got this as a tiny gift to add to my boyfriends Valentine's Day present. I was too excited to use it and gave it to him ahead of time lol. So much nicer than having a bulky controller. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Seriously flawed design
customer_reviews.text: This remote is seriously flawed for one reason -- it requires direct line of sight to your console to work. If you have your Xbox inside an entertainment box, or otherwise partially or fully obscured, this remote won't work. And even if you have the console it full view, it is incredibly particular in how you have to point the remote to get it to work. The Xbox controller and most other modern remotes don't rely on this outdated technology, so I'm not sure why they went for it here while also charging $40 for it. It feels nice in your hand and is well designed otherwise, but the line of sight requirement is a total deal killer for me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice controller, well built with a nice feel and back lit makes it even better
customer_reviews.text: I got so frustrated when watched blu-ray movies on my xbox and had to pause the movie or rewind or anything trying to figure out the sequence of controls to do the most simple thing and then i'd bump the bumper button and skip to the next chapter... it was just annoying. This remote is now used a lot more than I expected I would. Any and all movie/video streaming/playing and I use this. The volume controls and mute works fine. Pausing or otherwise controlling the movie works just fine with other apps, but especially with the blu-ray player this is worth it's price already.
customer_reviews.author: Erick B

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I can now control my TV, console and surround system with my Xbox set-up. I love it! This remote is wonderful. It feels great, very sturdy. The lighted keypad is very helpful. I can navigate through easier than using the gaming controller. The other accessories I recommend, IR emitter cable (if you don't have Kinect like me), and the Hauppague digital TV tuner (if you don't have cable or satellite like me). I'm definitely getting a second one before they get discontinued. This is an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: DestinyGnome

customer_reviews.title: Need Kinect to control the TV, but otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to control Netflix with one hand, rather than using the two-handed controller and feeling like I'm captaining a space shuttle every time I want to watch Parks and Rec. The buttons light up when you lift it up, without even pressing them, which is nice, but you seem to need a Kinect or IR cable to control the TV volume, so this remote works as is for selecting, playing, and pausing video, but will not necessarily work to control volume, mute, or power on or off the TV unless you have other equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan O

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on August 3, 2016 for $18.98, and even at that price I scoffed at it. But this thing has been amazing. It gets literal daily use, and lots of abuse. Its been dropped dozens of times, thrown about and genuinely abused. Its been awesome. Gets great battery life, works perfectly after these 3 years. The color is worn off the corners from rubbing against our palms but all the buttons look brand new, and works brand new. If youre on the fence and you can find this for ~$20 do it. Dont pay more than like $25/$30
customer_reviews.author: D. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: 9 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: It works as intended however the only downside is that you still have to point the remote towards the Xbox One so if you have something blocked it will not function at all you would have thought Microsoft learned their lesson by now they should have used the connection similar to like the Xbox One controller all you have to do is sync it so you can use it at any direction doesn't matter where at least Sony did it better by using Bluetooth come on Microsoft I know you can do better than this you have the money to do it so use it 😑
customer_reviews.author: Eliezer Martinez

customer_reviews.title: functional remote with nice features, but key layout could be improved
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this remote is that with a slight nudge it lights up making it easy to use at night. As a key part of using our xbox one for media (netflix, hulu and amazon video) it provides all the functionality I expect in a compact unit. One minor nit, after years of blindly using remotes from dozens of manufactures i'm still not used to the placement of the volume up/down buttons as they are slightly lower than my finger expects.
customer_reviews.author: A. Radin

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked OK to start, but as others have mentioned, you have to point it directly at the front of the Xbox (no angle) to get it to work. Recently (2-1/2 years after buying it, and without ever using it particularly much), it just stopped working. You have to click two or three times before the Xbox "sees" the click. I've changed the batteries and it makes no difference. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Scratchie

customer_reviews.title: Eh.. It did the job for a while
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years this is on its last legs. I guess thats not bad in this world of planned obsolescence but I always hope for better. Cant turn off the xbox with the "X" button. Have to surf through menus or.. ya-know.. get up. It usually takes 2 clicks now to get it to do what you want. It worked well for a while. Its small and has that new velvety feel which was nice and I enjoyed the light up on movement so it was easy to find (its invisible in the dark). I am disappointed in it so I am going to try another brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Oldtimer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as you insert the batteries into this remote.. it automatically connects to the nearest xbox. You can turn on the xbox .. turn it off. navigate at the home screen, tv screen, movie scree... this is well worth the price.. also you will save tons on battery life from not having to use your controller. the remorte lights up when moved even the slightest ..i believe it conserves batter y by sleeping when not in use.. it must have a gyroscope inside to let it know its being used by movement.Highly recommend if your xbox is your home entertainment system.
customer_reviews.author: Buka

customer_reviews.title: Nice but stopped working at 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 4 months with little use. Was pretty good before that point. Contacting Amazon and/or Microsoft about replacement. Well, it only has a 90 day warranty so this was a waste of money. Dropped from 2 stars to 1 star. Not gonna take the risk of buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Shredder

customer_reviews.title: I do enjoy the soft feel of the remote and its buttons
customer_reviews.text: This remote serves its purpose and is a significant improvement over the Xbox 360 media remote. I do enjoy the soft feel of the remote and its buttons. The backlit buttons also come on when you pick it up and turn off after about 10 seconds which is nice. The only drawback is that the remote uses Infrared line of sight (LOS) technology which can be annoying if something is blocking the path. I do hope Microsoft will release an updated remote with bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: One Remote to Control them All!
customer_reviews.text: Very functional and exactly what I was looking for. Now there's one remote to control them all! Saves the batteries on my game controllers and eliminates the inconvenience of restarting a game controller after it has been sitting dormant for a period of time. Even my wife abandoned her beloved cable box remote, after she discovered this remote has a last channel feature AND she discovered how awesome OneGuide is. Really, these should just come with the Xbox One.
customer_reviews.author: El_Andino

customer_reviews.title: This is a really well done remote, most Microsoft ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well done remote, most Microsoft accessories seem to be really well designed\made, and this isn't an exception. It has a soft touch back cover, lighting (automatically when you move it enough as in simply pick it up), operates my xbox one s with ease. After installing the blu ray app on the xbox (odd it isn't preinstalled, even if it would need an update), the blu ray functions flawlessly and quickly. Just loading a disc in the xbox launches the app and within seconds you are at the movie menu. Seems much faster than my PS3, no real side by side comparison though. It works, it's fast, and this remote makes it a breeze to operate.
customer_reviews.author: R. March

customer_reviews.title: Great xbox one remote
customer_reviews.text: So I decided to get Netflix for the family or for the wife that is via Xbox one. The controller is just to difficult to use so I found this remote for the Xbox one that is for using just for movies on Netflix or dvd's or blueray for my Xbox. Its so cool. The remote is heavy duty and feels heavy duty. The buttons light up so you can see the remote functions. And my wife found it very easy to use too. Lastly the remote also has a motion sensor that makes the keys light up so when you pic it up you can see the keys instantly. All in All its a fantastic remote!
customer_reviews.author: Joel V.

customer_reviews.title: Work fine, but will not control TV without Kinect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote to watch YouTube TV with my Sharp TV and Xbox One. It works fine for controlling the Xbox and the instant on feature is very handy, but after attempting to program it to control the volume and power on my TV I was very disappointed to learn that you must have Kinect to do this. This is a serious limitation of the device's functionality which Microsoft should more prominently describe in the features.
customer_reviews.author: Billymay

customer_reviews.title: Line of sight required
customer_reviews.text: Infrared Line of Sight Required, does not work like the Xbox Controllers. Does NOT work if your Xbox is in a cabinet or behind your tv. Now I have to get an IF extender to make it work. I’ll update my review if it actually works later on.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Wiggum

customer_reviews.title: Just Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: OK I love the idea of an Xbox remote but it isn't all its cracked up to be. The remote has to be in clear view of the Xbox in order to work, so if I'm like on the floor trying to tell my Xbox that I want to watch Bob's Burgers on Netflix, I can't. Which is mainly the reason why I got this remote, bc I didn't want to continue wasting batteries in my controller for dumb things like this. But other than that the remote works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote
customer_reviews.text: Love this remote! The cool thing is it doesn't need any programing or anything, worked right out of the box. It has a neat gyro or something it to keep it balanced too, so it's weighted nice and doesn't really tip over. Very smooth feeling in hand. Also cool thing is it easily control more than one Xbox no problem. If you like me and have more than one you just point in the direction of the one you wish to control, then point it towards the other. Or if you point at both at the same time, it will actually control both simultaneously lol
customer_reviews.author: Levi C

customer_reviews.title: I typically love Xbox products
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this instead of a regular controller since we mostly use the Xbox for watching movies and TV. I typically love Xbox products, but I think they missed the mark a little on this remote. The functionality is good if you are jsut Playing/Pausing/Rewinding/FastForwarding, but if you have to navigate anywhere within the XBOX dashboard is it a little difficult. The buttons are a little hard to push and you have to nearly directly in front of the XBOX for it to pick up the signal. It does the job, but has a lot of room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyN__c

customer_reviews.title: Much better than controller for streaming content
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Works well and quickly without lag. My wife is MUCH happier about using this to control Netflix and other streaming content rather than pulling out my controller and messing with that (which she always hit the triggers or wrong buttons and got frustrated). Plus it isn't always on like a controller must be, so battery savings there. Also like how the buttons light up when you pick it up so you can see what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: maXtreme477

customer_reviews.title: It has a curved base so it doesn't sit flat either and is easy to rock left or right
customer_reviews.text: This is an IR remote (not wireless) that provides a simpler interface for watching DVD and BluRay movies than you'd get using the controller. But it isn't required for watching movies -- it's merely a convenience. My only complaint is that the lighting is motion sensitive so bumping it at all will turn on the lights under the keypad for a short while. It has a curved base so it doesn't sit flat either and is easy to rock left or right. So far I haven't had to replace the batteries (that are included with it), but I wish the motion sensitivity could be adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Controller with Slight Deficiency
customer_reviews.text: It is great that I no longer need an actual controller just to use our stream video on Netflix, Amazon, YouTube, etc. It is well made and feels great in your hand. It lights up when it's touched or moved. However, it has no capacity for using the X,Y,A,B buttons. If you need to actuate them, you need to turn on the controller. This remote is a great addition to the Xbox One media functions. Its got good range and great battery life. The back lighting feature is really convenient when watching a movie in a dark room. Its bright enough to read but not blinding like a lot of remotes. For the price it cant be beat, Great Value
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Important note to buyers: you have to have a kinect for this to work. I have a kinect that we never use. I removed it once and this remote stopped working. I have my system set up where the TV volume is always off and the home theater system is controlled through the Xbox. I use the control mainly for volume, and it works great. I like the lightup feature, because the remote often falls somewhere with the way my kids shift around while watching movies. That feature helps us find it in those cases.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Remote to get for Xbox
customer_reviews.text: If you jumping between a lot of apps on your xbox and don’t like using the controller this remote is the one to get. It’s a solid remote feels good in your hands and found it much easier to navigate the menus over the clunky controller. The only reason I don’t give it 5 stars is you have to be pointing remote in direction of the xbox so I’m guessing it’s infrared red. Besides that, I would recommend this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L WeschTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: Like the remote.  Wish it could "Sign-In" and had better efficacy angle.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the remote but it's a bit finicky with "responsiveness" I sit about 15 feet away and the remote has to be pointed directly at the Xbox one. I'm not talking, like, line of sight... I mean like pointed like a laser pointer, in order to get the remote functions to respond. Could be the batteries I suppose, but it came this way. I still need to "Sign-in" with a controller to use netflix etc. It would be great if there was a keypad or other method of entry so that you could sign-in using it.
customer_reviews.author: S Shap

customer_reviews.title: Must own for movie watching.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why I waited so long to buy one of these. It’s the best thing to have if you watch movies on your Xbox. With the actual controller it will shut off after time and if you need to pause or control your movie in any way you have to wait for the controller to power back on. With this remote it works just like a normal remote. No waiting for it to power on it’s always ready. It also has a nice backlight on the controller when you move it so you can see the buttons. I think this is a must have for anyone who watches movies on an Xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Billy R

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: The remote works flawlessly but it isn't very comfortable to hold. Odd shape and greasy feel. Also, not all video apps map buttons appropriately for a remote. For example, press the X button to go to the beginning of the movie, or whatever. Not a fault of this particular remote per say, but you can't completely replace a controller for some actions. I dig how the buttons light up when you pick up the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Grimace73

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and a must have! Until it in stops working
customer_reviews.text: It is a definite must have for when not playing games on your Xbox One S. It works with every media app I have (Netflix, Hulu, HBO, CW, FXNOW, etc). With that being said, my remote just stopped working. It lights up, but no response when buttons are pressed (I've verified it's not the Xbox since my gaming remotes still work). This happened before in February, but after 30 minutes it started working again, so I didn't think anything of it until now. It's been two days and it still doesn't work. Even with all of this, I still highly recommend it and will purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Finally!!
customer_reviews.text: We use our One X as our one stop entertainment hub. Aside from gaming, we stream Hulu, Prime and Netflix. Not to mention 4K Blu-ray’s. Such a pain in the butt using the controller for so long. This awesome little remote has this rubberized coating And activates very clear backlight keys with any motion. Batteries have lasted months. Seriously, what took them so long. Very high-quality little unit
customer_reviews.author: MpressM

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory for your XBox One
customer_reviews.text: If you watch movies, either Blu-ray or streaming, this is perfect. I have 2 Xbox Ones and I just ordered a 2nd remote. When you pick it up, the buttons light up. So much nicer than using a controller that turns off automatically. Makes it so much easier. Makes you wonder why all remotes don't light up when handled like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and perfect
customer_reviews.text: Came highly recommended, got it today and it turned on my xbox first try without a setup. Turned on my receiver and TV due to CEC being enabled and controls my receiver for the same reason. Fit's well in the hand and lights up when bumped. Only complaint as I've heard that it's line of sight, but I'm willing to let that slide
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good remote with a few problems.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the remote. The rubberized coating gives the remote a nice feel and I like the buttons. It's shaped nicely to fit in your hand Is touch lit. But, I had a few problems, the biggest being it didn't work with my Philips TV to control the volume. I even tried to manually enter the TV model and still didn't work, but works with my receiver so it's not a deal breaker for me. Shape causes remote to teeter. ABXY buttons and a number pad would have been nice. Too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. A couple things annoy me about it. There aren't a lot of features you have access to like you do using the regular xbone joystick...like pressing Y to search in Netflix. You have to access these features in another, longer, way. Also, the battery cover pops off relatively easily if it falls on the ground. Way easier than it should. I'm waiting for it to break. Pros...the light-up feature comes in handy sometimes and I'm happy that the lights go out quickly when not in use. The texture feels great. Buttons all feel nice. Overall, it's okay. A perfect 3-stars IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality remote with backlit buttons.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this due to the price, but I was so annoyed with using the controllers while watching movies I decided to get it. I was really impressed with the quality of the remote upon arrival. It hooked right up to my Xbox no problem. The backlit buttons are really nice and turn on whenever you pick up the controller. And it’s so great not having to turn it on and off like an Xbox controller. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't have to sync up remote to Xbox one. :)
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. Lights up, which is good for me because I'm in the dark watching TV or gaming. I use it on my Xbox one to watch sling and Netflix. I got tired of using my Xbox one controller to control sling. I didn't even have to set this puppy up. I got it out of the box, put the batteries in it, and it synced up to my Xbox. All o did was press the Xbox button. All together, it's a fantastic remote. I've had rip off versions but they just aren't good. I'm glad I invested the extra money and just got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Best

customer_reviews.title: Great idea/doesn't work consistently enough to rely on
customer_reviews.text: The concept of this is fantastic but in practice I have rarely been able to get it to work. I'm fine with it being IR instead of RF (Which would be nice) but it is just inconsistent in working to control different video apps and adds to the frustration of needing to then go get the xbox controller anyway to pause/navigate after finding this thing doesn't work. Hopefully this is a software issue and they can get this worked out at some point.
customer_reviews.author: ahenderson

customer_reviews.title: The only annoying thing is that you have to hit a button ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this so many times since I've bought it. The original batter has lasted over a year. Works well. The only annoying thing is that you have to hit a button twice when you first turn on the Xbox, for the Xbox to register it. Very minor, but annoying none the less.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wittlinger

customer_reviews.title: After years of using the gaming controller for Netflix, this is a miracle!!!
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend always had problems trying to use the gaming controller to run netflix, HBO, and hulu through the X-box. Too many buttons, none of them labeled for tv control, and she would bump something and accidentally start fast forwarding, like every single day, literally. This is easy to use and MUCH better than how we were doing it. Feels nice, works nice, batteries included, no more turning on the gaming controller every time I want to pause a movie. Worth every penny. I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jake bullet

customer_reviews.title: Use it more than the regular remotes!
customer_reviews.text: It’s unfortunate that Kinect didn’t catch on because a lot of people are missing out on universal device control using their Xbox and this remote. Works extremely well using IR, NOT Bluetooth like I initially though before buying. Design seems to be made to handle spills, as the buttons seem to be seamless with the exception of the Xbox button. Great product, buttons light up when you grab it with some type of movement detection, only wish the mute button wasn’t flush with the remote (strange that it’s the only button like that).
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: An excellent remote control and a great addition to our Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations with this remote because, well, it's Microsoft and I have rarely had good luck with a Microsoft product. This is the single product that is changing my mind. This remote is AWESOME. It is ergonomic, easy to hold, the buttons are laid out in a common sense layout, the buttons even light up when it senses movement! Yes, it even successfully interacts with the Xbox One. Using an Xbox controller for casual TV viewing works but is not entirely convenient all the time, sometimes it's kind of annoying. This remote is a fantastic addition to our Xbox One and I recommend it to any Xbox One user who uses the console for more than gaming.
customer_reviews.author: B. Downen

customer_reviews.title: Noice
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic; it's been great since 99% of my xbox use is for watching TV/Movies on Plex and not having to turn on/off the xbox controller has been great. I would give it 5 stars if it was a bit cheaper - I feel like $40 is pretty steep, but considering MS's controllers are normally $50+ I guess it's par for the course.
customer_reviews.author: Jarf

customer_reviews.title: Best (movie) remote I've used for any of the game consoles
customer_reviews.text: Update, I bought a second one to use on Xbox #2 in another room and am very happy with that second remote as well. Works very well, light up action of the keys is spot on, and makes this my favorite remote for watching movies. It connects easily, and wakes up/goes to sleep in a timely manner. Best remote I've used for any of the game consoles. I read all the complaints about it not connecting in other reviews, maybe I've been lucky because of my Xbox placement in the room, but I've never had any connecting issues with this at all. Not one time. (FWIW, Xbox is sitting on top of a cabinet directly under the TV)
customer_reviews.author: H J Duff

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: That works great. It takes about six seconds for the Xbox one remote to connect to the console. It feels like a lifetime when I'm watching Netflix and I need to pause my show. With this remote, it works like any other remote. It's always on standby, easy to work, and works great on Amazon app, DVD's and bluerays, YouTube, & Netflix (those are all the apps I use). I'm happy with this product and it's a very good price for all it has to offer. I'm so happy I don't have to keep turning on and off my controller in order to watch movies, it's a waist of batteries and takes way too much time.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made! I love the sophisticated feel of the remote and how the buttons light up as soon as you pick it up. I was a little disappointed, however, to find out that you have to have Kinect to get the remote to control the volume on the TV, but I can definitely live with that. Using this remote instead of the regular Xbox controller will make the controller's batteries last a lot longer! I considered saving $10 and getting the off-brand, but I'm glad I didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Burchett

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We use this to watch video/tv and it controls our Xbox, TV, and A/V receiver. So, for most video apps (and the TV that comes in through the antenna), we can use it to select, start, stop, ff, rwd, change the volume, and more. However, it is currently broken in some notable apps that it used to be compatible with (e.g. Netflix), so that's kind of a bummer. Possibly that will change with an upcoming software update, as it was a software update that broke that functionality. So. Mostly awesome.
customer_reviews.author: eyetrieditathome

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft got it right!
customer_reviews.text: If a remote can be "cool", this is by far the coolest remote I've ever owned. What makes it special is the internal motion sensor in conjunction with back-lit buttons. The slightest bump or nudge of the remote causes it to light up, then quickly fade back to "off" if it doesn't detect any further movement. I can't even begin to tell you how great this is when you're fumbling for the controls in a darkened room. This remote is VERY line-of-sight, so make sure you're pointing it directly at the xbox or it won't pick up on the signal. I would say it's advertised effective range of 30 feet is accurate. Now to see how long the batteries last...
customer_reviews.author: Montana Brister

customer_reviews.title: Great For Living Room Integration
customer_reviews.text: the Xbox One remote is a very helpful remote if you plan on integrating your Xbox One into your shared living room. Its simple, straightforward, and easy for non-Xbox users to pick up and navigate the dashboard with. I purchases this so that my roommates would be able to easily use the Xbox media setting since they were not as familiar with the Xbox controller setting. Remote back light is a very nice feature, and dims quickly after you set it down so not to be obnoxious. My only complaint is the remote must be aimed directly towards the Xbox console, Unlike the normal control which can be used almost anywhere in the adjacent rooms.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Not at all worth it
customer_reviews.text: This remote is terrible. Not only does the motion activation kill batteries, it doesn’t have nearly the functionality that you would expect from a Microsoft made product for the Xbox One. If you have to hit one of the standard controller buttons in an app to do something, forget about it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: It's quite good!
customer_reviews.text: The shape and size of this remote are perfect, and the soft-touch rubber prevents it from slipping in your hand. It has just enough buttons to do everything you need. It automatically lights up when you move it, also, which is a fantastic feature for using it in the dark. My only complaint is that it's kind of picky about where you point it. My old Playstation 3 remote used Bluetooth, I believe, and could be pointed anywhere and register your inputs. This Xbox One remote must be IR, since it doesn't work all the time if there are any obstructions in your way. Overall, it's a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: H. Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Good,  but lacking functions
customer_reviews.text: We watch blu-ray and streaming video on our Xbox every day and we love this remote. It makes the simple navigation of movie menus and Netflix much faster and simpler. However, the remote does not possess some of the function buttons found on the Xbox controller, which prevents this remote from ever completely replacing the controller. It was a poor design decision that means you still need to keep a controller handy for some menus and applications (Amazon, for example). It's a good remote that could have been nearly perfect by adding the X, Y, A, B buttons.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Line of sight, not like controllers
customer_reviews.text: Remote works okay. We use it to watch Hulu and netflix on the xbox without having to deal with keeping a controller on and the aggravation of accidentally hitting the controller buttons when you try to set it down. It is not however like the controllers - we keep our xbox inside our entertainment center and they work fine with the doors shut - this requires we open the door so the remote has line of sight to the xbox, which kinda sucks if you are setup like we are. Overall it works well though. It wouldn't work with hulu when we first started using it, but a reboot of the xbox solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sapere Aude

customer_reviews.title: Simple, works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my wife doesn't like using an Xbox controller to control the TV. She immediately got the hang of the remote and went from always having issues navigating the TV to rarely needing my help. Worth every penny. It's a fairly simple interface with only a handful of buttons. I wouldn't expect anything complex out of this. This worked well for us because I wanted to control the TV/Cable through my Xbox without the need for a controller.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Eusanio

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay, but...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, adds convenience. Having to not turn on and off controller is nice. And the buttons make apps like Netflix,Hulu, and the blu Ray player better. But it’s sensor sucks. I don’t know why they didn’t make it like the controller. You have to point it perfectly At the Xbox one. Lame. But still better than controller. It goes on when moved.
customer_reviews.author: Stevo87

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you have great line of sight to your Xbox
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says. My only complaint is that the IR transmission is not as strong as I would like. I have few issues with my TiVo remote and the placement of my TiVo, but this remote does not transmit nearly as clearly to the Xbox which is kept in the same location. If you have very direct line of sight, shouldn't be a problem for you. I'm bouncing off a wall to get to my electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Jason JS

customer_reviews.title: The instruction manual lead me to believe the remote can ...
customer_reviews.text: The instruction manual lead me to believe the remote can be turned off when not in use, simply by holding down the X button. That is not the case. My remote is constantly on, and since it lights up with every movement, I assume the batteries won't last long. It's also a bit larger than I expected. But it gets the job done. I didn't want to have to keep using a controller when I'm watching something on my Xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IR Dependent.
customer_reviews.text: Why doesn't this pair with the xbox. Very disappointed that it has to have clear view of the console for it to work. Just figured in this day and age IR was dead for consoles. Sony PlayStation can do it. Xbox needs to do this as well. Looks like this is getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: Essential for using xbox as media streamer
customer_reviews.text: Game changer. Now that the xbox is a legitimate streaming media center, I use it for netflix, prime video, and YouTube TV. better than looking like a damn fool using the RB and LB bumpers on the controller to fast forward and rewind. Added bonus, turning on the xbox using the remote turns on the TV as well.
customer_reviews.author: panfriednoodles

customer_reviews.title: SO CONVENIENT!
customer_reviews.text: I hate waiting for the Xbox controller to turn on while I'm trying to pause my Netflix show, or just to make any adjustments at all. Also, using the Xbox controller feels bulky when you're just trying to flip through to find something to watch, so my husband bought this remote for me. I JUST LOVE IT! It automatically fires up and is ready to go the second you touch it. The backlighting automatically comes on. There are just the right amount of buttons. And this may be a weird comment, but it has a luxurious, suede-type feel to it. I'm superbly happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: pugsnkisses

customer_reviews.title: Great universal remote for TV, receiver, Xbox.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to simplify the Xbox remote for my non-gaming wife, but was pleasantly surprised to find it could completely replace three remotes. It was easy to get our LG TV and Pioneer receiver power and volume controls on it and now it is the only remote we need.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Deshpande

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who has an Xbox One and was constantly using the control to browse the apps. This is great, lets him watch Netflix and feel like he's watching regular tv. He can shut off the Xbox as well without having to reach for the control again.
customer_reviews.author: Fleur~de~Lis

customer_reviews.title: Great remote, bad customer support
customer_reviews.text: Remote control works well. I was definitely tired of using the standard Xbox One controller. I use it on all the apps. Netflix, Hulu etc. My only problem is that the light on the controller doesn't work. I emailed the company and no response. So the customer service is garbage. I let them know about it before I left review and they don't seem to care. Last purchase from me. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Hurdville

customer_reviews.title: This works amazingly well, eliminated all of my remotes for just this one
customer_reviews.text: We connected our Xfinity box, Sound Bar and TV directly to the Xbox One S and now control it all with just this one remote. People complain about the IR signal that it uses, but for me I appreciate it, it allows me to control my sound bar which is also IR.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Rose

customer_reviews.title: Aim is off
customer_reviews.text: So I love the look and feel of it. The buttons are very comfortable. It’s a pleasure to use. But it only works if it’s aimed anywhere from 4 o’clock to 9 o’clock. It does not work at all with the remote aimed at the TV, Xbox or Cable box. I cannot seem to get out of the habit of aiming my remotes toward devices, to start aiming the thing at my balcony doors, which is why it gets 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: It is excellent quality, very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We recently got rid of our cable subscription and now use the Xbox to stream Netflix, Hulu and Amazon Video. I would be lost without this remote. It is excellent quality, very easy to use, even my mother is now able to navigate the Xbox. I would recommend this for anyone who uses an Xbox for anything other than gaming. It is also very durable, I can't count how many times my toddler (or myself, the cat, you name it!) has dropped this on the floor, and it has never stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a knock off, get this one as it is worth the small difference in price!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought an Xbox One media remote with a cheap knockoff design. The buttons didn't work consistently, it have to be aimed very carefully at the Xbox and generally wasn't useful as much as frustrating. This one made by Microsoft is so much better that I can't begin to explain it. It is reliable, it lights up when picked up or touched, it has a soft feeling to the surface, it fits the hand nicely. Only complaint with it is the all black design makes it disappear in the dark, especially with its small size.
customer_reviews.author: PNWGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We don't have cable, just use Netflix and other streaming services. This remote is the perfect thing for watching movies. Not more messing with a joystick that moves down instead of to the side like you wanted. Or having to wait for the controller to turn back on and connect to the Xbox so you can pause it. This remote is motion sensors and connects right away. We bought this awhile back now and still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Karlie

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing for Video Apps
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever for Netflix and Youtube and Hulu and all those other video apps. No more having to turn on the controller or anything. Just use the little remote. There is the slight issue that sometimes the apps say use the Y button or something so you can't really do that with the remote but thats fine. (Y is usually search so thats still acceptable by scrolling to the top). I use this all the time. People have challenged me to try and use this one a game but no- not going to try that.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Philips

customer_reviews.title: Love this remote.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love watching netflix on our xbox. This remote is perfect for just that. We can pause, rewind, fastforward without having to pick up a regular remote, turn it on, make our selection and turn it off again. This remote turns on when you need it and off when not in use. Only thing that other people have disliked is that you actually have to point it to the xbox as you would with a tv remote. That's not too much of a problem for us though. Our puppy ended up eating and destroying this remote, but we loved it so much we had to order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Lina P.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as I wanted it to. I was worried, I saw reviews saying it didn't work with Netflix or Hulu but I can confirm it works with all of them just fine. I can now use my Xbox without wasting the batteries on my controllers. It's great for browsing Hulu, Netflix, Youtube, Amazon, everything. If you're looking for a remote to use on your Xbox, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Bond

customer_reviews.title: it would be nice to have the button names more closely align with ...
customer_reviews.text: More convenient than using the controller (especially for the non-gamers in the house), but the button pushes have to be very deliberate with the remote pointing straight at the unit. Also, it would be nice to have the button names more closely align with the on-screen command options, which are designed around the controller. For example, a screen might tell you to push the red 'B' button to go back. Well, there is no 'B' button on this remote. Nowhere near as nice to use or as intuitive as a Roku or AFTV remote.
customer_reviews.author: whiteboyslo

customer_reviews.title: Handy accessory for using Xbox to stream TV and movies.
customer_reviews.text: This makes navigating menus like Amazon Instant Video, Hulu, or Netflix much easier than using a bulky controller, and is convenient to keep by the bedside since it is smaller than the game pad. Occasionally the Xbox will not respond to the remote, but after I let it sit for a few minutes it tends to work again. Not sure why, maybe because I bought this product used. Overall it is a good device.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent accessory if you mostly use your Xbox for movies
customer_reviews.text: The Xbox One, at least for me, is as much a media player as it is a games console. This remote makes a very nice accessory for this purpose, mostly because you don't have to have a regular controller on and draining battery. The remote feels nicely made and premium, and has back lighting that activates when it's picked up. All together a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Max1045

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I love this remote. My husband got an Xbox One and I hated trying to navigate everything with the controller. This was my husbands solution for me. It is great. I love that it "turns on" when I pick the remote up. When you sit the remote down and no one touches it, the buttons turn off so it is almost like it is in standby mode. It takes two AAA batteries, and it comes with a set so that helps. It took me a while to learn what some of the symbols meant and I still hit the wrong one sometimes but it is still great.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice and solid. Works right out of the box without having to pair.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this right away after I got my Xbone, cause my wife's first complain was "I'm not going to use that gamepad to watch TV." I was impressed that I just put the batteries on and pressed a button and the Xbone recognized it immediately without me having to pair it with the Xbone. A big thing that made me want this beside the wife, was that it has the volume controls on the remote, a thing you don't get with the gamepad. Already recommended it to my brother and a coworker and they bought at least one for each.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Total gamechanger
customer_reviews.text: We've had an Xbox One since launch and just now got around to buying a remote for it. We stream most of our entertainment and previously used a Roku 3 for streaming purposes. We started using our Xbox to stream via the Rooster Teeth First app when it launched and HATED using a controller to control playback. Once we received the remote, we now watch nearly all of our content (not just Rooster Teeth but Netflix, Amazon, Youtube, etc) through the Xbox. We used to use the Xbox primarily for gaming and now it's truly an entertainment console.
customer_reviews.author: JHI

customer_reviews.title: B buttons on it like the old remotes for the 360
customer_reviews.text: works as intended, wish it had the X,Y,A,B buttons on it like the old remotes for the 360. Think they were going for less "game" look but it hurts functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little remote.
customer_reviews.text: Great little remote. The back slides off where you place two included AAA batteries. The remote does a very cool party trick. When you pick up the remote or move the remote it instantly lights up. Very cool! The remote is infrared so you must point it at the Xbox one. The remote has a basic set of functionality. The remote has:Volume control, channel up and down, home and menu buttons. Mute, up, down, left, right and basic Ouse play fast forward and rewind. But the nicest is the back button. Very helpful! The remote is very responsive assuming you point it at the Xbox one. I love it and so does the family.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Bowden

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote with one interesting flaw
customer_reviews.text: Solid Remote. Makes the XBox easier to use. Bug with the Volume and Mute buttons however (they didn't consistently work when pressed)...Solution I found on the internet was to hold the remote at a 45 degree angle to the floor, and surprisingly..that worked (and I don't understand why). Works great, but is certainly not without its flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: How Did I Live Without This?
customer_reviews.text: I love this remote! It controls every part of your Xbox. Even inside Netflix and other apps. It's made of a rubbery material (if you're a makeup lover it's like NARS packaging). The light turns off after a short time of no use, but it lights back up as soon as you move it. It doesn't turn off like controllers do, and you can even use it to turn the Xbox on. I don't know how I ever lived without this remote!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great way to stop wasting my gaming remote's battery
customer_reviews.text: This remote does not connect to the xbox and stay on wasting battery, it is like every other media remote where it only consumes power when pressed. In this particular remote it will light up when moved (aka when you pick it up to use it) but if you press a button while it's aiming at the console and it's not lit up, it absolutely still works. It's just a back light for in the dark control. It's quite comfortable, no set up required just point and click, and the buttons work with youtube, netflix, blu-ray player,etc.
customer_reviews.author: T. Proctor

customer_reviews.title: This remote is great. Feels good in the hand and has a ...
customer_reviews.text: This remote is great. Feels good in the hand and has a long battery life. People complain about having to point it at the Xbox but I haven’t found that to be the case. Sure if you point it directly opposite it won’t work. But it works great if you just point it in the general direction.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: YES, you do want to buy this.
customer_reviews.text: So, this is Black across the top until you pick it up, then the buttons light up. I dig that. It works well too, so that is a real plus. I REALLY like this one. I had the other one for the xbox 360 and that one works, but this one is way cooler. It is also small. So, don't lose it. That is all I have. ok. one more thing. the texture is sexy too. ok, that is it. It is a remote. Who doesn't want a remote?
customer_reviews.author: All for a Fool

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: This product is the worst that Microsoft has ever produced. The remote has maybe a 6 ft range. It has to be pointed directly at the xbox, and won't work if you have it at the slightest angle. They wasted space in the remote with a motion sensor. Why the hell does it need a motion sensor?
customer_reviews.author: Stephi

customer_reviews.title: Essential add-on for Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Does everything I need it to. Works great with the Sling TV app, Xbox One guide, etc. Yes it can work with your Soundbar independently from your TV volume which was a key selling point for me. Microsoft should really bundle this in with the base console, would make the Xbox One a more legit media center right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: BoiseBuddy

customer_reviews.title: Great to have but narrow beam
customer_reviews.text: Ever since Plex came out for XB1 this thing has been indispensable. The arrows can take some getting used to but it works well enough to get the job done without having to dig up an actual XB1 controller (which eats batteries or takes charging a lot more often). Only drawback is either the IR sensor on the XB1 or the transmitter on the XB1M Remote is incredibly narrow. You do have to point nearly directly at the XB1 to make sure it works. I don't mind it too much because my XB1 is in my line of sight but I'm sure others may have a problem with this.
customer_reviews.author: JRG

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, premium feeling accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient! Sure, you can navigate your Xbox's media apps and TV with the regular controller, with the kinnect or with the motion gestures, but sometimes I don't feel like waving my arms around or talking to my console. This remote lives in the same place as my TV remote so I can always get right to my media consumption. The device itself is VERY nice and made from a premium feeling, soft touch, almost rubberized plastic. It feels great in the hands. The buttons all have a backlight, too, that's activated by motion - pick up the remote and the lights come on for easy use in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: I really like this remote, way better thatn the bigger one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, he likes his remotes. I think it is awesome! I am not a gamer and the regular xbox one controller has way to many buttons for me and this one fits my hand perfectly, and it fits in your hand nicely. The buttons light up but dont stay on. The cool thing is it has motion sensor feature so if you pick it up the lights come on so you dont have to fumble with it. Very easy to use in my opinion and if I can use it that says something lol. My husband really liked it to.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunate. Feels good, lacks functionality.
customer_reviews.text: The unit feels good in the hand. It lights up when you pick it up. Looks sleek. I have not had the line of sigh issues other reviews mentioned what so ever. No programming required. Unfortunately it doesn't have the necessary buttons (ABXY) that the app developers such as Amazon and Netflix require. I can not program it to work with my TV and sound without the Kinect. It's going back for lack of functionality. Better off using the SmartGlass app for you smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: DerekBird

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this remote
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this remote. I primarily use my Xbox for Netflix, YouTube TV, and other media. It works as a universal remote if you setup your Xbox to control the TV and will turn on/off your TV sand Xbox with one easy button! It lights up whenever you pick it up so you can always see the buttons. Very low profile, great simple remote.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C B

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I watch a lot of tv on my Xbox and using the controller just gets tedious one of my buddies has this media remote so I decided to get one myself shipping time was quick and setup was a breeze works really and couldn’t be happier does what it suppose too
customer_reviews.author: J. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It’s so much better using this to do things like watch Netflix on Xbox. Just note that you HAVE to point it at the Xbox for this to work. Not a big deal to me but some people get frustrated about it not working when they aren’t pointing it directly at the Xbox
customer_reviews.author: Ape

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't perform as well as a universal remote for xbox navigation despite it's premium pricing.
customer_reviews.text: A decent remote for the Xbox One, but the price is difficult to justify and it's a little clunky to navigate the xbox on this remote with the most recent dashboard update. You're probably better off with a standard universal remote.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Roughton

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this remote! I use the Kinect for a lot of commands, but one of the things I was always annoyed with was the volume command. And with the addition of Cortana in the latest update it was even worse. This remote works perfectly for that and more. I am able to use it for most of the apps (Netflix, Amazon, etc) without issues. Weird side note: The remote smells wonderful, kind of like lemongrass. Not sure what is in the material that makes it smell like that, but I like it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kiki Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great! Such a time saver!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this, it works and looks great. No more pressing 'A' and then cycling through different options to find the the play/pause or other buttons. The best part is you only need to pick it up or shift it to turn it and its back lights on (the remote). It has a button to turn on the Xbox. The texture and material is awesome. I love the feel of the back side.
customer_reviews.author: Jameson

customer_reviews.title: This is easy to leave on the coffee table or end table ...
customer_reviews.text: We have our cable box routed through the Xbox. We use this daily, but mostly for TV volume and turning the Xbox on and off when we don't want to yell to have it turn off by the voice commands or get a game controller out. This is easy to leave on the coffee table or end table while leaving the game controllers on the charger. Battery seems to last a long time. Backlit keys light up based on moving the remote which is nice when watching late at night.
customer_reviews.author: G. M.

product_meta.title: Xbox One Media Remote
product_meta.description: Your favorite entertainment is at your fingertips with the Xbox one media remote. You're in control of Blu-ray movies, streaming video, apps, TV power, and volume. Featuring backlit keys that light up automatically, and direct access to the one guide, this simple, powerful remote is designed to help you watch and switch instantly
feature_bullets: Easy-to-use remote to control your entertainment - Compatible With Xbox One X, Xbox One S, Xbox One
Stays on, eliminating the need to keep turning on an Xbox One controller to control your Xbox One
OneGuide button provides one-touch, quick access to all of your favorites in one place
Control video playback for Blu-ray movies and streaming video on Xbox One
Compatible with Xbox Series X, Xbox One, Windows 10
Up to 30 foot range (straight line from console) and includes an Infrared (IR) transmitter and motion-activated backlit buttons.
